Description: Painted wooden shabti of Inh3y with a black lappet-wig, a brown modelled face and a blue and green collar that encloses the brown hands that hold red hoes; the yellow leg section is inscribed with black Hieroglyphic text; red seed-basket and yoke with two nw-pots on the back; the body is wrapped in a length of linen.
Curator's comments: The closely similar shabtis EA 54091, 54092 and 54094 all have an identical arrangement of texts, and a central inscription with several very poorly-formed signs. Another example appeared at auction, Christie's, Paris, 20/12/2011, lot 164. EA 54093, inscribed for the same owner as the others, has much more authentic-looking texts. Could the others be modern copies, based on this original? (JHT)
Condition: fair - some damage to the surface
